alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 30 at 8:53PM MST until January 01 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO NOON MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, except 6 to 12 above 9,000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph creating areas of reduced visibilities in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, West Central Plateau, West Central Mountains, Southwest Mountains, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Upper Rio Grande Valley, and South Central Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon Friday to Noon MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. These hazardous conditions will impact the holiday travel period.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
